abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            unsatisfactory, sustainability is unlikely, and
            institutional development impacts were only modest. Lessons
            suggest that market linkage development require further
            interventions, not only market liberalization in accord with
            public sector financing of technology development, since on
            their own, these are not sufficient conditions for adoption
            of new technologies. Rather, road network improvements,
            development of farmers organizations, and, development of
            savings, and credit associations with financing
            institutions, together with supportive rural buying agents
            are needed, to increase farmers capacity. Thus priority
            should be given to training provision, to ensure the balance
            between theory, and practical skills, to become more
            demand-driven, placing stronger emphasis on enabling
            extensionists in providing effective participatory
            techniques. Furthermore, sound financial management,
            internal auditing, and progress monitoring systems should be
            established to improve performance, and cost-effectiveness,
            possibly outsourcing to local organizations, under
            supervision by independent external consultants. But
            mechanisms should be established to ensure accountability of
            research, and extension practices, considering empowerment
            of farmer organizations, as well as public, private, and
            non-governmental organizations responsiveness to pluralistic requirements.
